root.name: Globals
root.description:
Global variables are declared outside functions and are readable throughout the program. If you wish to modify or create a global variable from within a function, you must use the global Python statement: 
# We create the global x.
x = 0

def keyPressed():
    # We want to modify the global x.
    global x
    x = x + 1

def draw():
    # We wish to read the global x.
    ellipse(x, height / 2, 10, 10)
